snippet: Rolando Sarraff Trujillo, who was released Wednesday from a Cuban prison where he had been held since 1995, provided information on codes used by Cuban spies.
abstract: Rolando Sarraff Trujillo, who was released from Cuban prison after nearly 20 years as part of Cuban prisoner exchange, gave important code information to Central Intelligence Agency to help detect spies; while his work for the CIA is still classified, his clandestine operations helped agency long after he was arrested.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI, MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and FRANCES ROBLES
byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti and Michael S. Schmidt reported from Washington, and Frances Robles from Miami. Kitty Bennett contributed research from St. Petersburg, Fla.

lead_paragraph: Rolando Sarraff Trujillo, who was released Wednesday from a Cuban prison where he had been held since 1995, provided information on codes used by Cuban spies.

headline.main: Crucial Spy in Cuba Paid a Heavy Cold War Price
headline.print_headline: Crucial Spy in Cuba Paid a Heavy Cold War Price
